threepio.tabler
Class Path

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      java.util.AbstractList<E>
          java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>
              threepio.tabler.Path
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String>, java.util.Collection<java.lang.String>, java.util.List<java.lang.String>, java.util.RandomAccess
public class Path
extends java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>
implements java.lang.Comparable

Path represents a path, where names are separated by a delimiter.

Author:
jhoule
See Also:
Serialized Form

determines if this path and another share a direct parent.

Parameters:
p - - another path
Returns:
true iff this path and p are children of the same direct parent, false if not.

compareTo

public int compareTo(java.lang.Object o)
Specified by:
compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable

removeI

public Path removeI()
removes the "ith" notation from the path. this is commonly found with Array-type objects in BBF XML.

Returns:
a Path that is this one, without the "ith" notation.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
overwritten to correctly re-form the path from this structure.

Overrides:
toString in class java.util.AbstractCollection<java.lang.String>
Returns:
a string representation of this Path.

removeLast

public Path removeLast()
removes the last item from the Path.

Returns:
a Path that is like this one, but does not have the last part.

getLastPart

public java.lang.String getLastPart()
returns the last part of the path, or rootName if there is no path.

Returns:
the last part of the path, rootName if none.

isArray

public boolean isArray()
determines if this is the path of an Array-type object in BBF XML.

Returns:
true iff the path is for an Array-type object, false iff not.
